predictions.text: A bill proposing a federal credit-card APR cap of 10% (or lower) will be introduced in the U.S. House and referred to House Financial Services (or a relevant House committee), by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Congress.gov shows a House bill introduced by the deadline whose text/summary sets a nationwide credit-card interest rate cap <=10% APR, and the bill is referred to a House committee (e.g., Financial Services).
evidence: Trump floated a 10% credit-card APR cap; policy risk shifts to bank margins and credit availability (CNBC, 2026-01-21).
monitoring_signals: Congress.gov keyword alerts: "APR cap", "credit card rate cap", "usury"
House Financial Services press releases and hearing notices
Statements from House/Senate leadership and relevant committee chairs
predictions.rationale: Populist consumer-finance proposals often get a prompt messaging bill even if passage is uncertain; introduction threshold is low.

predictions.text: The U.S. House Financial Services Committee (or a subcommittee) will hold at least one hearing where the published title explicitly includes "credit card" and "interest rate" or "APR cap", by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Committee schedule/announcement archives show a hearing by the deadline whose official title contains both (a) "credit card" and (b) "APR" or "interest rate" or "rate cap".
evidence: Trump floated a 10% credit-card APR cap; policy risk shifts to bank margins and credit availability (CNBC, 2026-01-21).
monitoring_signals: House Financial Services hearing calendar
Witness lists and hearing memos
Related Senate Banking committee scheduling as a leading indicator
predictions.rationale: A hearing is a higher bar than bill introduction; still plausible given public attention and industry pushback.

predictions.text: The CBOE Volatility Index (VIX) will close at or above 25.00 on at least one U.S. trading day, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: CBOE daily close for VIX is >= 25.00 on any trading day on or before the deadline.
evidence: Large, policy-driven equity swings after tariff reversals highlight elevated regime uncertainty for investors (MarketWatch, 2026-01-21).
monitoring_signals: VIX term structure steepening/inversion
1-month SPX implied volatility moves
Major tariff/immigration/financial-regulation headlines causing gap moves
predictions.rationale: Policy-driven regime uncertainty typically produces at least one volatility spike over a 2-month window.

predictions.text: NYMEX Henry Hub natural gas front-month futures will settle at or above $5.50 per MMBtu on at least one trading day, by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: CME/NYMEX official settlement price for the Henry Hub NG front-month contract is >= $5.50/MMBtu on any trading day on or before the deadline.
evidence: Arctic storm risk pushed U.S. natural-gas prices sharply higher, underscoring winter weather sensitivity (CNBC, 2026-01-21).
monitoring_signals: NOAA temperature anomalies and HDD forecasts
EIA weekly storage withdrawals vs 5-year average
LNG feedgas demand and pipeline constraints
predictions.rationale: Late-winter weather shocks can still produce sharp, brief price spikes; threshold is high but achievable in a cold scenario.

predictions.text: The Bank of Korea will cut its Base Rate by at least 25 basis points (one move or cumulative), by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Bank of Korea Monetary Policy Board announcements show a Base Rate level at least 0.25 percentage points below the level in effect on 2026-01-22, at any time on or before the deadline.
evidence: South Korea’s Q4 growth slowed to 1.5% as construction and exports fell (CNBC, 2026-01-22).
monitoring_signals: Korea CPI and core CPI trend
KRW exchange-rate stress and capital flows
BoK meeting statements and voting splits
predictions.rationale: Growth softness and export headwinds increase the likelihood of easing, though currency and inflation constraints remain.

predictions.text: Japan’s monthly trade statistics will show exports to the United States down at least 10.0% year-over-year in at least one release, by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Japan Ministry of Finance (customs/trade) release tables show YoY % change for exports to the U.S. <= -10.0% for any month reported in a release published on or before the deadline.
evidence: Japan export growth missed estimates as shipments to the U.S. plunged (CNBC, 2026-01-22).
monitoring_signals: Monthly Japan trade releases (MOF)
U.S. import data by origin for key Japan categories (autos, machinery)
JPY moves affecting nominal trade values
predictions.rationale: Recent weakness plus policy uncertainty raises odds of at least one sharp negative print, but base effects and FX can offset.

predictions.text: Meta will disclose a distinct Threads advertising metric in an earnings communication (earnings release, prepared remarks, or call transcript)—specifically either (a) Threads ad revenue, (b) Threads ad impressions, or (c) Threads ad load—by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Meta quarterly earnings materials or call transcript by the deadline explicitly report a Threads-specific advertising metric: revenue, impressions, or ad load (not merely stating ads exist).
evidence: Meta rolling out Threads ads globally expands monetization inventory (CNBC, 2026-01-21).
monitoring_signals: Meta earnings calls (Q1–Q4 2026) and 10-Q disclosures
Investor presentations mentioning Threads monetization
Ad buyer guidance or measurement documentation referencing Threads
predictions.rationale: Platforms often monetize without breaking out metrics; disclosure tends to occur if monetization becomes strategically material or scrutinized by investors.

predictions.text: Blue Origin will file at least one application with the U.S. FCC explicitly seeking authorization for a non-geostationary satellite broadband system or associated earth stations under its newly announced satellite-internet service branding, by 2026-09-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: FCC ECFS/IBFS records show a Blue Origin filing by the deadline that explicitly references satellite broadband/internet service and seeks authorization (constellation and/or earth stations), with the service name/brand mentioned in the filing.
evidence: Blue Origin launched a satellite-internet service, escalating LEO broadband competition (CNBC, 2026-01-21).
monitoring_signals: FCC ECFS/IBFS docket searches for Blue Origin and brand terms
ITU filings or U.S. administration spectrum coordination notices
Hiring/contracting for ground segment and user terminals
predictions.rationale: A genuine broadband offering typically requires visible regulatory filings; timing depends on readiness and spectrum strategy.

predictions.text: At least one U.S. state will enact a law explicitly prohibiting internet voting for public elections (excluding internal party processes), by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: A state governor signs (or a legislature enacts over veto) a bill by the deadline whose operative text explicitly bans casting ballots via the internet/online systems for public elections (statewide or local).
evidence: Princeton security researchers argue internet voting remains fundamentally insecure (Princeton CITP, 2026-01-16).
monitoring_signals: State bill trackers (NCSL, LegiScan) for 'internet voting'/'online voting' bans
Secretaries of State and election-security coalition statements
Cyber incident disclosures affecting election systems
predictions.rationale: Election-security research can spur state action, but many states already restrict internet voting; incremental enactment risk remains moderate.

predictions.text: A Phase 1 (or Phase 1/2) human clinical trial for a cartilage-regeneration or osteoarthritis therapy directly based on the Stanford-reported cartilage regrowth approach will be newly registered on ClinicalTrials.gov, by 2026-12-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: ClinicalTrials.gov shows a new trial record posted by the deadline that (a) is Phase 1 or Phase 1/2, (b) targets cartilage regeneration/osteoarthritis, and (c) explicitly references the Stanford group’s compound/technique or the specific named approach described in their publication/press materials (via investigators, sponsor, or protocol description).
evidence: Stanford researchers report cartilage regrowth and arthritis prevention in early work (ScienceDaily, 2026-01-20).
monitoring_signals: ClinicalTrials.gov new postings with 'cartilage regeneration'/'osteoarthritis' keywords
Stanford tech transfer/licensing announcements and spinout formation
FDA IND-related press releases or conference abstracts
predictions.rationale: Translation from early results to registered human trials can occur within a year but often slips due to toxicology/manufacturing and financing.
